explanations_en: Wrong. Evolution doesn't work by cost efficiency of pigments. Chlorophyll evolved because it effectively captures the most useful wavelengths of light for photosynthesis.

Correct! Leaves contain chlorophyll, which absorbs red and blue light for photosynthesis. Green light is not absorbed, so it bounces back to our eyes. That's why leaves look green. This color isn't random - chlorophyll evolved to capture the most useful light wavelengths for making food!
Wrong. Leaf color is about light absorption for photosynthesis, not heat. Chlorophyll absorbs red and blue light for energy, reflecting green light we see.
Wrong. Leaves aren't green to camouflage with the environment. The green color is a byproduct of chlorophyll reflecting green light while absorbing red and blue for photosynthesis.
explanations_zh: 错误。进化并非依据色素成本效益运作。叶绿素之所以进化，是因为它能有效捕捉对光合作用最有用的光波波长。
没错！叶子含有叶绿素，它能吸收红光和蓝光进行光合作用。绿光不被吸收，因此反射回我们的眼睛，这就是叶子看起来是绿色的原因。这种颜色并非偶然——叶绿素在进化过程中选择了捕捉对制造食物最有用的光波长！
错误。叶子的颜色与光合作用中光的吸收有关，而非热量。叶绿素吸收红光和蓝光以获取能量，反射出我们看到的绿光。
不对。叶子并非为了伪装环境而呈绿色。绿色是叶绿素在吸收红光和蓝光进行光合作用时反射绿光所产生的副产品。

questions.question_en: Why do flowers have bright colors?
explanations_en: Wrong. Flowers don't need to absorb sunlight - that's the job of leaves with chlorophyll. Flower colors are for attracting pollinators, not photosynthesis.

Correct! Bright flower colors attract pollinators like bees, butterflies, and birds. Different colors attract different animals: bees see UV patterns, hummingbirds prefer red, butterflies like bright colors. This partnership helps plants reproduce. The more attractive the flower, the more visits it gets!
Wrong. While some pigments may provide minor UV protection, the primary function of bright flower colors is to attract pollinators for reproduction.
Wrong. Flower colors aren't health indicators for other plants. They evolved specifically to attract animal pollinators through visual signals.
explanations_zh: 不对。花朵不需要吸收阳光——那是含有叶绿素的叶子的任务。花色是为了吸引传粉者，而非进行光合作用。
没错！鲜艳的花朵颜色能吸引蜜蜂、蝴蝶和鸟类等传粉者。不同的颜色会吸引不同的动物：蜜蜂能看到紫外线图案，蜂鸟偏爱红色，蝴蝶则喜欢鲜艳的色彩。这种合作关系有助于植物繁殖。花朵越吸引人，来访的传粉者就越多！
错误。虽然某些色素可能提供轻微的紫外线防护，但鲜艳花朵颜色的主要功能是吸引传粉者以促进繁殖。
错误。花的颜色并非其他植物的健康指标，它们是通过视觉信号专门进化来吸引动物传粉者的。

questions.question_en: Why do tree leaves change color?
explanations_en: Wrong. Trees don't produce new pigments in fall. The yellow and orange colors were always there but hidden by green chlorophyll. Only red pigments are sometimes newly produced.

Correct! In fall, trees stop making chlorophyll as days get shorter. The green fades, revealing other pigments that were always there: yellow carotenoids and orange xanthophylls. Red and purple appear when sugars get trapped in leaves. This colorful show helps trees prepare for winter by recycling nutrients!
Wrong. Cold doesn't damage leaves to create colors. The color change is a controlled process where chlorophyll breaks down, revealing other pigments as trees prepare for winter.
Wrong. Water deficiency causes wilting and browning, not the beautiful fall colors. Autumn colors come from chlorophyll breakdown revealing other pigments as trees recycle nutrients.
explanations_zh: 不对。树木在秋天并不会产生新的色素。黄色和橙色其实一直都在，只是被绿色的叶绿素掩盖了。只有红色素有时会新生成。
正确！秋天，随着白昼变短，树木停止制造叶绿素，绿色褪去，显露出一直存在的其他色素：黄色的类胡萝卜素和橙色的叶黄素。当糖分被困在叶片中时，红色和紫色便会出现。这五彩斑斓的景象通过回收养分帮助树木为冬季做准备！
错误。寒冷并不会损伤叶子以产生颜色。颜色变化是一个受控过程，其中叶绿素分解，随着树木为冬季做准备，其他色素显现出来。
错误。缺水会导致枯萎和变黄，而非美丽的秋色。秋色来自叶绿素分解，当树木回收养分时，其他色素显现出来。

explanations_en: Wrong. While sunlight provides warmth, plants don't need it primarily for temperature. They need light energy for photosynthesis to create their own food.

Correct! Plants use sunlight as energy for photosynthesis - a process where they convert carbon dioxide and water into glucose (sugar) and oxygen. This happens in chloroplasts using chlorophyll. Without sunlight, plants can't make food and will eventually die. Light is literally their energy source!
Wrong. Plants don't use sunlight to dry moisture. In fact, sunlight can increase transpiration (water loss), but the main reason plants need light is for photosynthesis to produce food.
Wrong. While plants do grow toward light, they don't need sunlight just to grow taller. They need light energy for photosynthesis to create the sugars that fuel all growth processes.
explanations_zh: 不对。虽然阳光能带来温暖，但植物主要并非依赖它来调节温度。它们需要光能进行光合作用，以制造自己的养分。
正确！植物利用阳光作为光合作用的能量来源——这是一个将二氧化碳和水转化为葡萄糖（糖）和氧气的过程。这一过程发生在含有叶绿素的叶绿体中。没有阳光，植物就无法制造食物，最终会死亡。光实质上就是它们的能量来源！
错误。植物并非利用阳光来干燥水分。实际上，阳光会增加蒸腾作用（水分流失），但植物需要光的主要原因是进行光合作用以制造养分。
不对。虽然植物确实会向光生长，但它们不仅仅是为了长高才需要阳光。它们需要光能进行光合作用，以制造糖分来驱动所有生长过程。

questions.question_en: Why do trees shed leaves in autumn?
explanations_en: Wrong. Trees don't passively lose leaves to cold damage. Leaf drop is an active, controlled process where trees form special cells to cut off leaves and conserve resources for winter.

Correct! Trees shed leaves as a survival strategy. In winter, frozen ground makes water scarce and leaves would lose too much water through transpiration. By dropping leaves, trees reduce water loss and save energy. They seal off leaves with a special layer, reabsorb nutrients, then let them fall. It's called dormancy!
Wrong. Trees don't shed leaves to make room for new ones. They drop leaves to survive winter by conserving water and energy when conditions are harsh.
Wrong. Wind doesn't cause leaf drop - it just helps already-loose leaves fall. Trees actively disconnect leaves by creating an abscission layer that cuts off water and nutrients first.
explanations_zh: 不对。树木并非因寒冷损伤而被动落叶。落叶是一个主动、受控的过程，树木会形成特殊细胞来切断叶子，以便为冬季保存资源。
正确！树木落叶是一种生存策略。冬季，土壤冻结导致水分稀缺，叶子会通过蒸腾作用失去大量水分。通过落叶，树木减少了水分流失并节省了能量。它们用特殊层封闭叶子，重新吸收养分，然后让叶子脱落。这被称为休眠期！
不对。树木落叶并非为了给新叶腾出空间，而是在环境恶劣时通过保存水分和能量来度过冬天。
不对。风并不会导致树叶掉落——它只是帮助已经松动的叶子落下。树木会主动断开叶子，先形成一层离层来切断水分和养分的供应。

explanations_en: Correct! Cacti evolved in deserts where rain is rare. They store water in thick, fleshy stems (not leaves - those became spines!). Their accordion-like ribs expand to hold water after rare rains. Waxy coating prevents evaporation. Some cacti can survive a year without rain by using stored water. Perfect desert adaptation!
Wrong. While stored water helps cacti tolerate heat, the primary reason for water storage is survival during long dry periods. Cacti can't rely on frequent rainfall in deserts.
Wrong. Cacti's spines (modified leaves) protect from predators, but water storage is for surviving drought. The water-filled tissue is actually attractive to thirsty desert animals!
Wrong. Cacti don't store water to support flowers. Water storage evolved to survive desert droughts where rain might not come for months or even years.
explanations_zh: 正确！仙人掌是在雨水稀少的沙漠中演化而来的。它们将水分储存在粗壮多肉的茎中（而非叶片——叶子已演变成刺！）。其手风琴般的肋条在罕见降雨后能扩张以储存水分。蜡质表层可防止水分蒸发。有些仙人掌依靠储存的水分，能在一年无雨的情况下存活。堪称完美的沙漠适应典范！
错误。虽然储存水分有助于仙人掌耐热，但其储水的主要原因是为了在长期干旱期间生存。沙漠中的仙人掌无法依赖频繁的降雨。
不对。仙人掌的刺（由叶子演化而来）是用来防御捕食者的，而储水则是为了在干旱中生存。实际上，充满水分的组织对口渴的沙漠动物来说极具吸引力！
错误。仙人掌储水并非为了供养花朵，而是为了在沙漠干旱中生存，那里可能数月甚至数年无雨。

questions.question_en: Why do bamboo grow so fast?
explanations_en: Wrong. While hollow stems help bamboo be lightweight and flexible, they don't explain the growth speed. Bamboo grows fast because cells are already formed underground and just expand.

Correct! Bamboo's secret is that all cells are created first in underground shoots. When conditions are right, these pre-formed cells just fill with water and expand - like inflating a balloon! Some species grow up to 91cm in 24 hours. Bamboo also has nodes that allow sections to grow simultaneously. Fastest growing plant on Earth!
Wrong. While bamboo does have extensive underground rhizomes (not deep roots), the fast growth comes from pre-formed cells rapidly expanding with water, not from pulling nutrients quickly.
Wrong. Though bamboo does absorb water to expand cells, the real reason for speed is that all cells are pre-formed underground and just need to inflate, rather than being created during growth.
explanations_zh: 不对。虽然中空的茎干让竹子变得轻便灵活，但这并不能解释其生长速度。竹子之所以长得快，是因为细胞在地下已经形成，只需扩张即可。
没错！竹子的秘密在于所有细胞都是先在地下竹笋中形成的。当条件适宜时，这些预先形成的细胞就会像吹气球一样吸水膨胀！有些品种在24小时内能长高91厘米。竹子还有竹节结构，使得各段能同步生长。它是地球上生长最快的植物！
错误。虽然竹子确实有广泛的地下根茎（并非深根），但其快速生长源于预先形成的细胞在水分作用下迅速扩张，而非快速吸收养分。
错误。虽然竹子确实通过吸水使细胞膨胀，但其快速生长的真正原因在于所有细胞在地下已预先形成，只需充水膨胀，而非在生长过程中生成。

questions.question_en: Why do sunflowers follow the sun?
explanations_en: Correct! Young sunflowers track the sun from east to west during the day (heliotropism). This maximizes photosynthesis by keeping leaves perpendicular to sunlight. At night, they turn back east to greet the sunrise. The mechanism involves growth hormones: auxin accumulates on the shaded side, causing faster growth there, turning the plant toward light. Mature sunflowers stop and face east!
Wrong. Sunflowers don't track the sun to warm petals. Young plants follow the sun to maximize light capture for photosynthesis. Interestingly, mature sunflowers stop moving and permanently face east.
Wrong. While east-facing mature sunflowers do attract more bees in warm morning sun, young sunflowers track the sun specifically to maximize photosynthesis for growth.

Wrong. Sun tracking isn't about water conservation. Sunflowers follow the sun to capture maximum light for photosynthesis. They use auxin hormones to grow faster on shaded sides, turning toward light.
explanations_zh: 正确！幼嫩的向日葵在白天会随着太阳从东向西转动（向光性）。这通过保持叶片与阳光垂直来最大化光合作用效率。到了夜晚，它们会转回东方迎接日出。其机制涉及生长激素：生长素在背光侧积累，导致该侧生长更快，从而使植株转向光源。成熟的向日葵则会停止转动，固定朝东！
不对。向日葵并非通过追随太阳来温暖花瓣，幼株追随太阳是为了最大限度地获取光照以进行光合作用。有趣的是，成熟的向日葵会停止转动，永久地朝向东方。
错误。虽然朝东的成熟向日葵在温暖的早晨阳光下确实能吸引更多蜜蜂，但年轻的向日葵追随太阳主要是为了最大限度地提高光合作用以促进生长。
不对。向日葵追踪太阳并非为了节水，而是为了获取最大光照进行光合作用。它们通过生长素在背光侧加速生长，从而转向光源。

questions.question_en: Why do fruits taste sour or sweet?
explanations_en: Wrong. Fruit flavors aren't random. They evolved specifically as signals to animals. Sour unripe fruits say 'not ready,' while sweet ripe fruits say 'eat me and spread my seeds!'

Correct! Fruits are sweet or sour as communication with animals. Unripe fruits are sour (high acid, low sugar) to discourage eating before seeds mature. Ripe fruits convert acids to sugars, becoming sweet to attract animals. Animals eat sweet fruit, walk away, and deposit seeds in droppings. Evolution's perfect partnership for seed dispersal!

Wrong. While temperature can affect sugar production in some fruits, the sour-to-sweet transition is primarily about ripeness signaling, not temperature. It's an evolutionary strategy for seed dispersal.
Wrong. Soil pH doesn't directly determine fruit taste. The sour-to-sweet change happens during ripening as plants convert acids to sugars, signaling animals that seeds are ready for dispersal.
explanations_zh: 不对。水果的味道并非随意形成，它们是专门为向动物传递信号而演化出来的。酸涩的未成熟果实意味着“还没好”，而甜美的成熟果实则在说“快吃了我，传播我的种子吧！”
正确！水果的甜或酸是与动物交流的方式。未成熟的水果味道酸（高酸低糖），以防止在种子成熟前被吃掉。成熟的水果将酸转化为糖，变得甜美以吸引动物。动物食用甜果后离开，通过粪便传播种子。这是进化中种子传播的完美合作！
错误。虽然温度会影响某些水果中糖分的产生，但酸转甜的过程主要与成熟信号有关，而非温度。这是一种种子传播的进化策略。
错误。土壤的酸碱度并不直接决定果实的味道。酸转甜的变化发生在果实成熟过程中，植物将酸转化为糖分，以此向动物传递种子已准备好传播的信号。

questions.question_en: Why do plants grow towards light?
explanations_en: Wrong. Light doesn't pull plants magnetically. Plants grow toward light through a hormone-mediated process where cells on the shaded side elongate, bending the plant toward the light source.

Correct! This is called phototropism. When light hits one side, auxin (growth hormone) moves to the shaded side. Auxin makes cells elongate faster, so the dark side grows longer, bending the stem toward light. It's the opposite of what you'd expect - the shaded side grows more! This ensures maximum photosynthesis. Discovered by Darwin!
Wrong. Actually, the opposite is true! The shaded side grows faster due to auxin accumulation, which causes the plant to bend toward light. The light side grows slower, not faster.
Wrong. Roots don't push plants toward light. The bending is caused by auxin hormone making cells on the shaded side of the stem elongate faster, turning the plant toward light.
explanations_zh: 错误。光线并非以磁力吸引植物。植物向光生长是通过激素调节的过程实现的，其中背光面的细胞会伸长，从而使植物向光源方向弯曲。
正确！这被称为向光性。当光线照射到一侧时，生长素（一种生长激素）会移动到背光侧。生长素促使细胞更快地伸长，因此背光侧生长得更长，使茎干向光源弯曲。这与你的预期相反——背光侧反而长得更多！这确保了光合作用最大化。这是达尔文发现的！
不对。实际上恰恰相反！由于生长素积累，背光侧生长得更快，导致植物向光弯曲。向光侧生长较慢，而非更快。
不对。根不会推动植物向光生长。植物的弯曲是由于生长素使得茎部背光一侧的细胞伸长更快，从而使植物转向光源。

questions.question_en: Why do pine trees stay green in winter?
explanations_en: Wrong. While needles can resist freezing somewhat, that's not why they stay green. The waxy coating and small surface area of needles prevent water loss, allowing pines to keep them year-round.
Wrong. Though pines do have some antifreeze-like compounds, the main reason they keep needles is their waxy coating and small surface area reduce water loss dramatically compared to broad leaves.
Wrong. While evergreens can photosynthesize slowly in winter, they keep green needles primarily because waxy coating and small size prevent water loss, making it efficient to retain them year-round.

Correct! Pine needles have thick waxy coating and small surface area, which minimizes water loss through transpiration. This makes it efficient to keep them year-round rather than regrow annually. Needle shape, waxy cuticle, and sunken stomata all reduce water loss. In harsh climates where growing season is short, keeping needles saves energy. That's why they're 'evergreen'!
explanations_zh: 错误。虽然针叶能一定程度上抵抗冰冻，但这并非它们保持绿色的原因。针叶表面的蜡质层和小面积减少了水分流失，使得松树能够全年保留它们。
错误。尽管松树确实含有一些类似防冻剂的化合物，但它们能保留针叶的主要原因在于其蜡质涂层和较小的表面积，相比阔叶树，这大大减少了水分流失。
错误。尽管常绿树木在冬季能缓慢进行光合作用，但它们保持绿叶主要是因为蜡质表层和细小的叶片能防止水分流失，这使得全年保留叶片更为高效。
正确！松针具有厚厚的蜡质层和小表面积，这能最大限度地减少通过蒸腾作用流失的水分，因此全年保留它们比每年重新生长更高效。针状形态、蜡质角质层和下陷的气孔都有助于减少水分流失。在生长季节短暂的恶劣气候中，保留针叶能节省能量。这就是它们被称为“常青树”的原因！

explanations_en: Correct! Onion layers are actually modified leaves called 'scales' attached to a short underground stem (bulb). The bulb is a storage organ where the onion saves food (sugars) made during photosynthesis. Each fleshy layer is a scale leaf packed with nutrients. This stored energy helps the onion survive dormancy and quickly grow when conditions improve. Not all onions form bulbs - green onions don't!

Wrong. Onion layers aren't for insect protection. They're modified leaves that store food (sugars and nutrients) for the plant. The onion bulb is an underground storage organ for surviving unfavorable conditions.

Wrong. Layers don't represent multiple seasons. Each layer is a modified leaf scale that stores food. The bulb forms in one season as a survival strategy, storing nutrients for dormancy and future growth.
Wrong. Onion layers don't help absorb water - that's the job of roots below the bulb. Layers are modified leaves that store food produced by the green leaves above ground.
explanations_zh: 正确！洋葱的鳞片实际上是附着在地下短茎（鳞茎）上的特化叶片，称为“鳞片”。鳞茎是洋葱储存光合作用所制造食物（糖分）的贮藏器官。每一片肉质层都是富含营养的鳞叶，这些储存的能量帮助洋葱在休眠期存活，并在条件改善时迅速生长。并非所有洋葱都形成鳞茎——例如青葱就不会！
不对。洋葱层并非用于防虫，它们是植物的变态叶，用于储存食物（糖分和养分）。洋葱鳞茎是地下储藏器官，帮助植物在不利条件下生存。
错误。鳞片并不代表多个季节。每一层都是储存养分的变态叶鳞。鳞茎在一个季节内形成，作为生存策略，为休眠和未来生长储存营养。
不对。洋葱的鳞片并不帮助吸收水分——那是球茎下方根部的职责。鳞片是变态叶，用于储存地上绿叶制造的食物。

explanations_en: Correct! Seeds need soil for multiple reasons: it provides physical support for roots to anchor, holds moisture for germination, supplies mineral nutrients once the seed's stored food runs out, and offers protection. Soil structure allows air circulation for root respiration. However, seeds don't absolutely need soil - hydroponics proves plants can grow in water with dissolved nutrients. But soil is nature's perfect growing medium!

Wrong. Seeds can actually germinate and grow without soil! Hydroponic systems grow plants in water with dissolved nutrients. Soil is ideal because it provides support, nutrients, and moisture, but it's not absolutely required.
Wrong. Seeds don't need soil to protect from sunlight. Many seeds actually need light to germinate. Soil provides physical support, nutrients, and moisture - that's why it's important.

Wrong. Soil doesn't 'activate' germination - water, oxygen, and suitable temperature do. Soil is important because it provides support, retains moisture, and supplies nutrients, but germination can happen without it (like in wet paper towels).
explanations_zh: 正确！种子需要土壤有多重原因：它为根系提供物理支撑以固定植株，保持水分促进萌发，在种子储存的养分耗尽后提供矿物质营养，并起到保护作用。土壤结构还能让空气流通，利于根系呼吸。不过，种子并非绝对依赖土壤——水培技术证明植物可以在含有溶解养分的水中生长。但土壤始终是大自然最理想的生长介质！
错误。实际上，种子没有土壤也能发芽生长！水培系统就是在含有溶解养分的水中培育植物。土壤之所以理想，是因为它能提供支撑、养分和水分，但这并非绝对必需。
错误。种子不需要土壤来遮挡阳光，许多种子实际上需要光照才能发芽。土壤提供物理支撑、养分和水分——这才是它重要的原因。
错误。土壤并不“激活”发芽过程——水分、氧气和适宜的温度才是关键。土壤的重要性在于它能提供支撑、保持水分并供应养分，但即便没有土壤（例如在湿纸巾中），种子也能发芽。

questions.question_en: Why do some plants close at night?
explanations_en: Correct! This is called nyctinasty - sleep movements controlled by circadian rhythms. Plants like prayer plants, mimosa, and clover fold leaves at night to conserve energy and water, reduce heat loss, and protect from nighttime cold. Special cells at leaf bases (pulvini) change pressure to move leaves. Some theories suggest it reduces fungal infection risk or prevents predation. It's not true sleep, but rhythmic daily movements!

Wrong. Plants don't sleep like animals (no brain or nervous system). Nyctinasty is a circadian rhythm response where plants fold leaves to conserve water, reduce heat loss, and protect from cold - not actual sleep.

Wrong. While closing might incidentally deter some insects, the main purpose of nyctinasty is conserving water and energy, reducing heat loss, and protecting from cold temperatures at night through circadian-controlled movements.

Wrong. Most plants that close at night are folding leaves, not flowers. Flower closing (different mechanism) does protect pollen, but leaf nyctinasty is about conserving water, energy, and reducing heat loss through circadian rhythms.
explanations_zh: 正确！这被称为感夜性——由昼夜节律控制的睡眠运动。像祈祷草、含羞草和三叶草这类植物在夜晚会合拢叶片，以节省能量和水分、减少热量散失，并抵御夜间寒冷。叶基部的特殊细胞（叶枕）通过改变压力来移动叶片。有理论认为这能降低真菌感染风险或防止被啃食。这并非真正的睡眠，而是有节律的日常活动！
错误。植物不像动物那样睡觉（没有大脑或神经系统）。夜动性是一种昼夜节律反应，植物通过折叠叶子来保存水分、减少热量散失并抵御寒冷——并非真正的睡眠。
错误。虽然闭合可能偶然阻止一些昆虫，但感夜性的主要目的是通过昼夜节律控制的运动来节约水分和能量，减少热量散失，并在夜间抵御低温。
错误。大多数在夜晚闭合的植物是折叠叶片，而非花朵。花朵闭合（机制不同）确实能保护花粉，但叶片夜动则是通过昼夜节律来保存水分、能量并减少热量散失。

questions.question_en: Why do some plants eat insects?
questions.question_zh: 为什么有些植物会捕食昆虫？
choices_zh: 植物觉得昆虫味道不错
植物进化出了捕猎的能力。
explanations_en: Wrong. Plants don't taste anything. They digest insects for nutrients, not flavor.

Correct! Carnivorous plants like Venus flytraps grow in nutrient-poor soil, especially lacking nitrogen. Catching insects supplements their diet. They still photosynthesize for energy—insects provide nutrients they can't get from poor soil!
Wrong. Plants don't actively hunt like animals. They use passive traps and haven't evolved predatory behavior.
Wrong. Plants trap insects for nutrition, not defense. They actually need insects to survive in poor soil.
explanations_zh: 不对。植物并不品尝任何东西。它们消化昆虫是为了获取营养，而不是为了味道。
没错！像捕蝇草这样的食肉植物生长在营养贫瘠的土壤中，尤其缺乏氮元素。捕捉昆虫可以补充它们的营养需求。它们仍通过光合作用获取能量——昆虫提供了它们无法从贫瘠土壤中获得的养分！
错误。植物不像动物那样主动捕猎，它们采用被动陷阱，并未进化出捕食行为。
错误。植物捕捉昆虫是为了获取营养，而非自卫。实际上，在贫瘠的土壤中，它们需要昆虫才能生存。

explanations_en: Correct! Thorns evolved to protect roses from being eaten by animals. They deter herbivores and browsers. Interestingly, rose thorns are technically 'prickles'—sharp outgrowths of the stem surface, not modified leaves or branches!
Wrong. Thorns don't significantly collect water. Defense against herbivores is their primary function.
Wrong. While some thorny plants climb, rose thorns primarily serve defense, not climbing support.
Wrong. Thorns don't store nutrients. They're defensive structures, not storage organs.
explanations_zh: 正确！玫瑰的刺是为了保护自己不被动物吃掉而进化出来的，它们能阻止食草动物和啃食者。有趣的是，玫瑰的刺严格来说属于“皮刺”——是茎表面尖锐的突起物，而非叶子或枝条的变形！
错误。刺并不显著地收集水分，其主要功能是防御食草动物。
错误。虽然有些带刺植物会攀爬，但玫瑰的刺主要起防御作用，而非攀爬辅助。
错误。刺并不储存养分，它们是防御结构，而非储存器官。

questions.question_en: Why do seeds need darkness to sprout?
questions.question_zh: 种子为何需要在黑暗中发芽？
choices_zh: 黑暗预示着土壤的深度
explanations_en: Wrong. Light doesn't damage seedlings. Many seeds actually need light to germinate.
Wrong. Darkness provides no energy. Seeds use stored energy regardless of light conditions.

Correct! Many seeds use darkness as a signal they're buried deep enough for safe growth. Light-requiring seeds won't sprout if buried too deep. This adaptation prevents wasted energy sprouting in poor conditions. Not all seeds need darkness though!
Wrong. Seeds don't sleep. They're metabolically inactive until conditions trigger germination.
explanations_zh: 错误。光线不会损害幼苗。实际上，许多种子需要光照才能发芽。
不对。黑暗不提供能量。无论光照条件如何，种子都使用储存的能量。
正确！许多种子将黑暗视为它们埋得足够深、能安全生长的信号。需要光照的种子如果埋得太深就不会发芽。这种适应机制避免了在不良条件下浪费能量发芽。不过，并非所有种子都需要黑暗！
不对。种子并不休眠，它们在条件触发萌发前代谢活动处于停滞状态。

questions.question_en: Why do trees have rings inside?
questions.question_zh: 为什么树木内部有年轮？
choices_zh: 树木记录着它们的年轮。
explanations_en: Wrong. Bark is on the outside. Rings form from new wood growth in the center, not bark.

Correct! Trees grow faster in spring/summer (light ring) and slower in fall (dark ring). Each pair is one year. Ring width shows growing conditions—thick rings mean good years. Scientists use rings to study climate history going back thousands of years!
Wrong. Water flows through the outer rings, but rings form from seasonal growth differences, not water transport.
Wrong. Rings don't intentionally mark age—they're a byproduct of seasonal growth variation.
explanations_zh: 不对。树皮长在外部。年轮是由中心新木质的生长形成的，而不是树皮。
正确！树木在春夏生长较快（浅色年轮），秋季较慢（深色年轮）。每对年轮代表一年，年轮宽度反映生长环境——宽年轮意味着风调雨顺。科学家通过年轮可追溯数千年的气候历史！
错误。水流经的是外层年轮，但年轮的形成源于季节生长差异，而非水分输送。
不对。年轮并非有意标记树木的年龄，它们是季节性生长变化的自然产物。
